channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blockage or restriction, 15th October
item.description:
From the photos it can be seen that a heavy storm of rain on Tuesday 08/10/24 onto already saturated ground allowed a River of water to start at top of field, the field has a substantial slope my front garden received a torrent of muddy water, there is a drain on the road outside my garden gate, but it was unable to cope with this amount of mud and water from the field, it over spilled the drain and flooded the road, opposite my bungalow is another & the volume of water washed all their driveway gravel down to their door went around the. side of house and filled their fish pond with muddy water, killing the fish, there is a further road drain by the gate of bungalow 3 this also could not cope with the mud and water volume, it is perhaps drain blockage or restriction but the danger is this could happen all over again, some investigation would seem to be required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colesbourne, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overhanging footpath. Adults have to bend awkwardly to get under it and for those of us with back/spinal problems, it is a risky move. I am really worried it could damage my back further. I walk to improve my mobility and so I want to keep walking up this beautiful footpath which is parallel to the main road. The overhanging tree is near the top of the footpath which ends opposite Daisy Bank Road., 14th October
item.description:
Near the top of the footpath which runs parallel to Leckhampton Hill Road. The lower part of the footpath starts at Leckhampton Views (off Leckhampton Road) which is a newish housing estate and the footpath ends opposite Daisybank Road - this is the top part and the overhanging tree is very near the top end. I think the storms caused the tree to bend severely. The footpath used to be clear to walk along.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling drain, 14th October
item.description:
I had automated email confirmation that report number 6576176 had been repaired. However, the drain cover is rattling and just as loud as it was before. My neighbours and I can't sleep at night or think straight during the day! I can see that they've put some tarmac in the gap around the drain cover but they haven't secured the drain cover down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes/damaged road outside 5/4 Newdawn Place, 14th October
item.description:
There are multiple holes in the road outside number 5 and number 4 Newdawn Place alongside Village Road. The road has also sunk outside number 6 which pools with water when there is rain. There's also a large amount of gravel which appears to have come from the damaged road which has ended up on the pavement all along the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 14th October
item.description:
(Email trail attached) Streetlighting requesting urgent removal of vegetation from around Streetlight ::: We have a multiple outage of columns 34 to 39 in Grovefield Way, Cheltenham. National Grid are not able to access column 38 as the control point for the outage and have asked that we arrange for urgent attention to this column please. I’m not sure if it should go through the LHR/AHR or direct to Ringway. The column is in Highway land and nothing to do with any resident. Is there some way you can expedite this for us please and ask for completion notice when the job has been done!
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nothing happening - what's going on??, 14th October
item.description:
Temp traffic lights have been there months but no work is ever taking place - it's causing delays for no reason. if it's to do wit the bike lane development then why has something been introduced at that area when it's not ready or if it's to do with levelling of the road it's been like that for months and nothing has happened. What's going on?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big hole around mancover, 14th October
item.description:
